description: When the user is mourning a loss, feeling sorrow over someone or something — needing comfort, divine perspective, and healing hope.

primary.text_en: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger... But give good tidings to the patient — who, when disaster strikes them, say, 'Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return.'
primary.text_ar: وَبَشِّرِ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَصَـٰبَتْهُم مُّصِيبَةٌ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّآ إِلَيْهِ رَٰجِعُونَ
primary.explanation: Grief is acknowledged — and so is your strength through patience.

primary.text_en: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.
primary.text_ar: فَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحۡزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَوۡنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
primary.explanation: Faith lifts you — even through pain.

primary.text_en: I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah...
primary.text_ar: إِنَّمَآ أَشۡكُوا۟ بَثِّى وَحُزۡنِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: Even prophets grieved — but directed their pain to Allah.

primary.text_en: ...Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us...
primary.explanation: You are not alone — not even now.

primary.text_en: Do people think they will be left alone because they say: ‘We believe,’ and will not be tested?
primary.text_ar: أَحَسِبَ ٱلنَّاسُ أَن يُتْرَكُوٓاْ أَن يَقُولُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا وَهُمۡ لَا يُفۡتَنُونَ
primary.explanation: Every loss carries wisdom, even when unseen.

primary.text_en: The eyes shed tears, and the heart feels grief, but we do not say except what pleases our Lord...
primary.explanation: Grief is not disbelief — it's a sign of love.

primary.text_en: Visit the sick, follow the funeral procession... and it will remind you of the Hereafter.
primary.explanation: Loss awakens eternity in our hearts.

primary.text_en: Whoever suffers a calamity and says: 'To Allah we belong and to Him we return,' O Allah, reward me... and replace it for me with something better — Allah will replace it.
primary.explanation: A powerful formula for healing after loss.

primary.text_en: A believer is not afflicted with discomfort, illness, anxiety, grief... except that Allah expiates some of his sins.
primary.explanation: Grief cleans the soul even as it aches.

primary.text_en: Whenever the Prophet ﷺ missed someone, he made dua for them and remembered them kindly.
primary.explanation: Your love doesn’t end — it transforms.

duas.text_en: O Allah, make me among those whom You guide, protect, forgive, and have mercy upon.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِمَّنْ هَدَيْتَ، وَعَافَيْتَ، وَغَفَرْتَ لَهُ، وَرَحِمْتَ
duas.explanation: A gentle blanket of mercy over a grieving soul.

duas.text_en: Our Lord! Pour upon us patience and cause us to die as Muslims.
duas.text_ar: رَبَّنَآ أَفۡرِغۡ عَلَيۡنَا صَبۡرٗا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسۡلِمِينَ
duas.explanation: Ask for strength — and a faithful ending.

reflection: Grief is love’s echo — it hurts because it mattered. Even the Prophet ﷺ buried children and companions with tears. But he also turned to prayer, to Allah’s mercy, and the promise of reunion. In every tear, remember: you will be reunited in gardens where no pain exists.
